data.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_ACCESS_LEVEL_DESCR
data.value: Select the level of access for this client. Do not select Read/Write if your application includes safety-related outputs.

data.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_ENABLED_DESCR
data.value: Enable access control for this TCM. If False, all users can access TCM resources. If True, you MUST configure a client with TriStation protocol access, or you will be unable to connect to the controller after the next download.

data.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_IP_ADDRESS_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address of the client you want to configure access for.

data.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_NETWORK_DESCR
data.value: Select the network(s) this client can access the TCM on.

data.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_PROTOCOLS_DESCR
data.value: Select the protocol(s) this client can use to access the TCM. Click a value once to select it; click it again to clear the selection.

data.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_SUBNET_MASK_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address for the subnet mask. Use this property to create groups of IP addresses with the same access level. The default selects all client IP addresses on the subnet.

data.name: ALERT_EXPORT_UNSAVED_CONFIG
data.value: ALERT: The configuration has been changed, but not yet saved. Unsaved changes to the configuration will be included in the exported file. Do you want to continue?

data.name: ALERT_IMPORT_UNSAVED_CONFIG
data.value: ALERT: The configuration has been changed, but not yet saved. Unsaved changes to the configuration will be overwritten by the settings in the imported file. Do you want to continue?

data.name: ALERT_MANY_TCPIP_INVALID_ON_SUBNET
data.value: One or more Modbus TCP IP addresses are not on the same subnet as the TCM.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_BAUD_RATE
data.value: Serial connection transmission speed in bits per second (bps).

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_DEFAULT_CONNECTION_TYPE
data.value: Default method for connecting to the controller.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_DESIGNATE_TCP_PORT
data.value: Select a specific port for transferring a project file to/from the controller.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_IP_ADDRESS
data.value: IP address for the TCM port connected to the network.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_NODE_NUMBER
data.value: Located on the front panel of the Main Chassis or MP-TCM Baseplate.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_SERIAL_PORT
data.value: COM port on TriStation workstation the serial cable is connected to.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_SYSTEM_NAME
data.value: Controller name. Use the default or enter your own.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_TCP_PORT
data.value: Enter a unique TCP port number. Configure your firewall to allow communication on this port.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_UDP_PORT
data.value: Port used for connection. Must be same as in TCM configuration.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_USE_NETWORK_CONNECTION
data.value: Configure a connection to the controller over the network.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_DESC_USE_SERIAL_CONNECTION
data.value: Configure a connection to the controller via a serial cable.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_NAME_BAUD_RATE
data.comment: Enable only if Use Serial Connection = TRUE.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_NAME_DEFAULT_CONNECTION_TYPE
data.comment: Enable only if BOTH Use Network Connection and Use Serial Connection = TRUE. Otherwise, default to the connection type with TRUE value.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_NAME_DESIGNATE_TCP_PORT
data.value: Designate TCP Port for Project File Transfer

data.name: COMM_PARAM_NAME_SERIAL_PORT
data.comment: Enable only if Use Serial Connection = TRUE.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_NAME_SYSTEM_NAME
data.comment: Default value depends on value of Node Number

data.name: COMM_PARAM_NAME_TCP_PORT
data.comment: Enable only if Use Specific Port... = TRUE.

data.name: COMM_PARAM_NAME_UDP_PORT
data.comment: Enable only if Use Network Connection = TRUE.

data.name: ERROR_CANNOT_MODIFY_WHEN_DLC
data.value: This value can’t be changed while the project is in the Download Changes state.

data.name: ERROR_DETECTED_P2P_IMPORT
data.value: Errors and/or alerts were detected during the Peer-to-Peer configuration import process. See %s for details.

data.name: ERROR_ENABLE_ACCESS_CONTROL
data.value:
When the TCM access control list is enabled, at least one installed TCM per system must have a client with TriStation Read/Write access, in order to allow future changes to the application running on the controller.
Either configure a client with Read/Write access to the controller using the TriStation protocol, or disable the TCM access control list.

data.name: ERROR_ENABLE_ACCESS_CONTROL_MSG
data.value: When the TCM access control list is enabled, at least one installed TCM per system must have a client with TriStation Read/Write access, in order to allow future changes to the application running on the controller. Either configure a client with Read/Write access to the controller using the TriStation protocol, or disable the TCM access control list.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_COMBOBOX_VALUE
data.value: Invalid selection. You must select a value that is available in the drop-down list.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_GATEWAY
data.value: Invalid Gateway IP Address. Enter a gateway IP address that is on the same subnet as the TCM.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_GATEWAY_IP
data.value: Invalid Default Gateway IP Address. Verify the address is in the correct format or in a valid range.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_HIGHEST_PORT
data.value: Invalid Highest TCP Port Number. Enter a port number that is greater than the Lowest TCP Port Number.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_IP_ADDRESS
data.value: Invalid IP address. Verify the address is in the correct format.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_IP_MODBUS_TCP_CLIENT
data.value: The selected port is configured for the Modbus TCP Client protocol. You must enter a valid server node IP address.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_IP_SUBNET_COMBO
data.value: Invalid IP Address and Subnet Mask address combination. The IP address must be within the subnet mask range.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_LOWEST_PORT
data.value: Invalid Lowest TCP Port Number. Enter a port number that is less than the Highest TCP Port Number.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_NET_IP
data.value: Invalid IP address. Verify the address is in the correct format or in a valid range.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_SUBNET
data.value: {0} is an invalid Subnet Mask address.

data.name: ERROR_INVALID_SUBNET_GATEWAY_COMBO
data.value: Invalid Gateway IP Address and Subnet Mask address combination. The IP address must be within the subnet mask range.

data.name: ERROR_IP_CONFLICT_WITH_ROUTING
data.value:
This network address configuration conflicts with one or more destination node IP addresses configured in the Routing section. Saving this configuration will reset the affected destination node(s) to the default values.
Click Yes to continue, or click No to keep the previously saved configuration.

data.name: ERROR_IP_GATEWAY_MISMATCH
data.value: Invalid Default Gateway IP Address. The default gateway address must match the network IP address on the enabled port.

data.name: ERROR_IP_INVALID
data.value: The specified IP address is invalid.

data.name: ERROR_IP_INVALID_ON_SUBNET
data.value: Invalid SNTP Server IP Address. Enter an IP address that is on the same subnet as the TCM.

data.name: ERROR_MODBUS_MAX_RANGE
data.value: Invalid Modbus Range: Maximum. Enter a number that is greater than or equal to the Modbus Range: Minimum.

data.name: ERROR_MODBUS_MIN_RANGE
data.value: Invalid Modbus Range: Minimum. Enter a number that is less than or equal to the Modbus Range: Maximum.

data.name: ERROR_MSG_INVALID_SYSTEM_NAME
data.value: Invalid system name. The name must have at least {0}, but no more than {1}, characters.

data.name: ERROR_MSG_INVALID_SYSTEM_NAME_NON_ENGLISH
data.value: Invalid system name. You cannot use Unicode (non-English) characters in system names.

data.name: ERROR_MSG_NODE_NUMBER
data.value: Invalid node number. Must be in the range {0} - {1}.

data.name: ERROR_MSG_NUMBER_OF_DAYS_BEFORE_ALARM_GEN
data.value: Invalid selection. The number of days must be in the range {0} - {1}.

data.name: ERROR_MSG_PROTOCOL_UPDATE_RATE
data.value: Invalid multicast update rate. Must be in the range {0} - {1}.

data.name: ERROR_MSG_TCP_PORT_NUMBER
data.value: Invalid TCP port number. Must be in the range {0} - {1}.

data.name: ERROR_MSG_UDP_PORT_NUMBER
data.value: Invalid UDP port number. Must be in the range {0} - {1}.

data.name: ERROR_P2P_IP_INVALID_ON_SUBNET
data.value: Invalid IP Address for node {0}. Enter an IP address that is on the same subnet as the TCM.

data.name: ERROR_PASTE_CELL_DISABLED
data.value: Unable to paste. Property is not enabled.

data.name: ERROR_PASTE_INVALID_ID_DETECTED
data.value: Unable to paste communication module properties because one or more values in the ID column were modified.

data.name: ERROR_PASTE_INVALID_PROPERTY_DETECTED
data.value: Unable to paste row: {0} > {1} > {2} because the property could not be found. Verify the Group, Subgroup and Property values in the copied data were not modified.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_FIRMWARE_MANAGER
data.value: The port number you entered is reserved for Firmware Manager. See Help for more information about reserved UDP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_HART_TCP_UDP_IN_USE
data.value: The port number you entered is either reserved or currently being used for the {0}. See Help for a complete list of reserved TCP and UDP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_PEER_TO_PEER
data.value: The port number you entered is either reserved or currently being used by the Peer-to-Peer UDP protocol. See Help for a complete list of reserved UDP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_PRINTER_TCP_IN_USE
data.value: The port number you entered is either reserved or currently being used for the {0}. See Help for a complete list of reserved TCP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_TSAA_PROTOCOL
data.value: The port number you entered is either reserved or currently being used by the TSAA protocol. See Help for a complete list of reserved UDP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_TS_HART_DTM
data.value: The port number you entered is either reserved or currently being used for HART DTM. See Help for a complete list of reserved UDP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_TS_HART_IP
data.value: The port number you entered is either reserved or currently being used for HART-IP. See Help for a complete list of reserved UDP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_TS_MANAGEMENT_PROTOCOL
data.value: The port number you entered is either reserved or currently being used by the Triconex Management protocol. See Help for a complete list of reserved UDP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PORT_TS_PROTOCOL
data.value: The port number you entered is either reserved or currently being used by the TriStation protocol. See Help for a complete list of reserved UDP port numbers.

data.name: ERROR_PRINTER_LINE_WIDTH
data.value: Invalid line width number. Must be in the range {0} - {1}.

data.name: ERROR_PRINTER_NUMBER
data.value: You cannot use the same printer number for the Left and Right slots. Enter a unique number for each slot.

data.name: ERROR_PRINTER_NUMBER_INVALID_IP
data.value: You must enter a valid Server IP Address before you can configure the Printer Number.

data.name: ERROR_PRINTER_TCM_SUBNET
data.value: Invalid Server IP Address. Enter a print server IP address that is on the same subnet as the TCM.

data.name: ERROR_RESET_IPADDRESS_CONFIRMATION
ERROR_ROUTING_GATEWAY_INVALID
data.value: The destination IP address and the destination Gateway address of the destination node {0} MUST be either both zero or both non-zero.

data.name: ERROR_ROUTING_GATEWAY_NOTCONNECTED
data.value: Invalid Gateway IP Address for destination node {0}. Enter an IP address that is on the same subnet as the TCM.

data.name: ERROR_TCPIP_INVALID_ON_SUBNET
data.value: Invalid Modbus TCP Client IP Address. Enter an IP address that is on the same subnet as the TCM.

data.name: ERROR_TIMESYNC_IPADDRESS_BLANK
data.value: You must enter a SNTP Server IP Address.

data.name: ERROR_TIMESYNC_IP_RESERVED
data.value: Invalid SNTP ServerIP Address. Enter an IP address that is not reserved for special purposes.

data.name: ERROR_TS_PROTOCOL_CONFIGURED_ALREADY
data.value: The TriStation protocol has already been configured for {0}. You cannot configure this protocol for both serial ports.

data.name: HART_DTM_ENABLED_DESCR
data.value: Allow clients to access HART data via the Triconex Controller DTM. Enabling HART DTM on multiple TCMs will reduce communication speed. Supported only for modules installed in COM1: Left.

data.name: HART_DTM_NET1_PORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the TCP port number used for connections on NET 1, in the range 0 - 65535. Enter 0 to disable HART on this port. Cannot be the same as a HART-IP port number.

data.name: HART_DTM_NET2_PORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the TCP port number used for connections on NET 2, in the range 0 - 65535. Enter 0 to disable HART on this port. Cannot be the same as a HART-IP port number.

data.name: HART_DTM_USE_SECURE_CONNECTION_DESCR
data.value: Enable secure HART communication through SSL. If enabled, you must also add certificates and private keys to your project.

data.name: HART_IP_ENABLED_DESCR
data.value: Allow HART device data to be transferred to an external HART-IP client via an IP-based network. Enabling HART-IP on multiple TCMs will reduce communication speed. Supported only for modules installed in COM1: Left.

data.name: HART_IP_NET1_PORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the TCP port number for connections on NET 1, in the range 0 - 65535. Enter 0 to disable HART-IP on this port. Can be the same as the NET 2 port, but cannot be the same as a HART DTM port.

data.name: HART_IP_NET2_PORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the TCP port number for connections on NET 2, in the range 0 - 65535. Enter 0 to disable HART-IP on this port. Can be the same as the NET 1 port, but cannot be the same as a HART DTM port.

data.name: HART_TSAA_ENABLED_DESCR
data.value: Allow TSAA clients to have read-only access to HART data using the TSAA protocol. Selected automatically when HART DTM or HART-IP are enabled. Supported only for modules installed in COM1: Left.

data.name: IOP_BUS_PARAM_DESC_IP_ADDRESS_A
data.value: IP address of Ethernet IOP Bus Channel A.

data.name: IOP_BUS_PARAM_DESC_IP_ADDRESS_B
data.value: IP address of Ethernet IOP Bus Channel B.

data.name: IOP_BUS_PARAM_DESC_IP_ADDRESS_C
data.value: IP address of Ethernet IOP Bus Channel C.

data.name: IOP_BUS_PARAM_DESC_USE_IOP_BUS
data.value: Select to configure IOP Bus parameters if an IMFF is installed.

data.name: IOP_BUS_PARAM_DESC_USE_SFP
data.value: Allow an SFP transceiver to be used on the IOP Bus.

data.name: IOP_BUS_PARAM_NAME_USE_SFP
data.comment: Enable only if I/O Bus Interface Module Installed = TRUE

data.name: LDAP_ALLOW_POINTS_PERMISSION
data.value:
You must perform a Download All after changing the Allow Points to Be Disabled property setting. However, you do not have the permissions required to perform a Download All. Contact your administrator to request the required permissions.
The Allow Points to Be Disabled property setting will remain unchanged.

data.name: MODBUS_CLIENT_LOGICAL_PORT_DESCR
data.value: The logical port number used by Modbus client functions to access this port. Must be unique for each TCM in a system. Available only when Modbus TCP Client is selected.

data.name: MODBUS_FLOATING_POINT_ORDERING_DESCR
data.value: Select which section of a 32-bit floating point number is read first. High = first 16 bits. Low = last 16 bits.

data.name: MODBUS_IP_ADDRESS_DESCR
data.value: If using Modbus TCP Client, enter the server node's IP address. If using Modbus TCP Server, enter 0.0.0.0 to accept communication from any Modbus client; enter a specific client IP address to accept communication only from that Modbus client.

data.name: MODBUS_MODBUS_RANGE_MAXIMUM_DESCR
data.value: The maximium REAL value that can be communicated over Modbus. Can be no more than 32767. Available only when Modbus TCP Server is selected.

data.name: MODBUS_MODBUS_RANGE_MINIMUM_DESCR
data.value: The minimum REAL value that can be communicated over Modbus. Can be no less than -32768. Available only when Modbus TCP Server is selected.

data.name: MODBUS_NETWORK_DESCR
data.value: Select the network this port is connected to.

data.name: MODBUS_PROTOCOL_DESCR
data.value: Select the Modbus communication protocol for this port.

data.name: MODBUS_TCP_PORT_NUMBER_DESCR
data.value: Enter the TCP port number for this port.

data.name: MODBUS_WRITE_ENABLED_DESCR
data.value: Allow Modbus writes to this port. Available only when Modbus TCP Server is selected.

data.name: MODULE_CHANGE_FILLDOWN
data.value: Fill down operation cannot be performed because the number of changed modules will exceed 15. Changes to these modules cannot be made until you perform a Download Changes operation. However, additional changes to the 15 modules that have already had a change applied are still allowed. See Help for more information.

data.name: MODULE_CHANGE_PASTE
data.value: Paste operation cannot be performed because the number of changed modules will exceed 15. Changes to these modules cannot be made until you perform a Download Changes operation. However, additional changes to the 15 modules that have already had a change applied are still allowed. See Help for more information.

data.name: NW_PARAM_NAME_DEFGATEWAY_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address of the default gateway. Must be part of the subnet.

data.name: NW_PARAM_NAME_HIPORT_DESCR
data.value: (Optional) If the TCM is behind a firewall, the highest TCP port number that can be used for outgoing connections from the TCM. Must be in the range 1024 - 65535.

data.name: NW_PARAM_NAME_INSTALLED_DESCR
data.value: Indicates whether the TCM is physically installed in the controller. Select True to enable configuration of the TCM. Select False to reset all properties to their default state and make the TCM unavailable for configuration.

data.name: NW_PARAM_NAME_IPSUBNET_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address for the subnet.

data.name: NW_PARAM_NAME_IP_ADDRESS_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address for the network port on the TCM. Network port addresses on the same TCM do not need to be unique.

data.name: NW_PARAM_NAME_LOPORT_DESCR
data.value: (Optional) If the TCM is behind a firewall, the lowest TCP port number that can be used for outgoing connections from the TCM. Must be in the range 1024 - 65535.

data.name: OP_PARAM_DESC_ALLOW_DISABLE_POINTS
data.value: Allow points to be disabled from TriStation 1131. Requires a Download All.

data.name: OP_PARAM_DESC_ALLOW_EXPIRED_CERT
data.value: Allow secure connections even if server/client certificate is expired.

data.name: OP_PARAM_DESC_GENERATE_ALARM_WHEN_EXP
data.value: Turn MP Fault LEDs on when server/client certificate expires.

data.name: OP_PARAM_DESC_NUM_OF_DAYS_BEFORE_ALARM_GEN
data.value: Number of days prior to certificate expiration alarm should be generated.

data.name: OP_PARAM_DESC_PREVENT_KEYSWITCH_STOP_FROM_HALTING
data.value: If keyswitch is turned to Stop, application on controller continues running.

data.name: OP_PARAM_DESC_PREVENT_REMOTE_WRITES
data.value: Prevent external devices from writing to output tagnames in the application.

data.name: OP_PARAM_DESC_USE_NODE_TIME_SYNC
data.value: Allow controller to act as primary node for time synchronization on the Peer-to-Peer network.

data.name: OP_PARAM_DESC_USE_SECURE_COMM
data.value: Enable secure communication between TriStation 1131 and the controller.

data.name: OP_PARAM_NAME_ALLOW_EXPIRED_CERT
data.comment: Enable only if Use Secure Communication = TRUE

data.name: OP_PARAM_NAME_GENERATE_ALARM_WHEN_EXP
data.comment: Enable only if Use Secure Communication = TRUE

data.name: OP_PARAM_NAME_NUM_OF_DAYS_BEFORE_ALARM_GEN
data.value: Number of Days Before Alarm Generation
data.comment: Enable only if Generate Alarm when Certificate Expires = TRUE

data.name: OP_PARAM_NAME_PREVENT_KEYSWITCH_STOP_FROM_HALTING
data.value: Prevent Keyswitch Stop from Halting Application

data.name: OP_PARAM_NAME_PREVENT_REMOTE_WRITES
data.value: Prevent Remote Writes to Output Tagnames

data.name: PEER_TO_PEER_DESTINATION_UDP_PORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the UDP base port number for this node. Do not change this setting unless the TCM is behind a firewall or you want to use a custom port number.

data.name: PEER_TO_PEER_IP_ADDRESS_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address for this node.

data.name: PEER_TO_PEER_NETWORK_DESCR
data.value: Select the network port the TCM uses to communicate with this Peer-to-Peer node (controller).

data.name: PEER_TO_PEER_UDP_BASE_PORT_NUM_NET1_DESCR
data.value: Enter the UDP base port number for the NET 1 port. Enter 0 to disable Peer-to-Peer on this network.

data.name: PEER_TO_PEER_UDP_BASE_PORT_NUM_NET2_DESCR
data.value: Enable Peer-to-Peer on this network by entering the UDP base port number for the NET 2 port. Peer-to-Peer is disabled on NET 2 by default.

data.name: PRINTER_PRINTER_NUMBER_DESCR
data.value: Select the printer number. Do not assign the same number to both TCM slots. The default 0 means a printer is not configured.

data.name: PRINTER_PRINT_LINEWIDTH_DESCR
data.value: Enter the number of characters to print on each line. Must be between 80 -132.

data.name: PRINTER_PRINT_SERVER_IP_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address of the print server.

data.name: PRINTER_PRINT_SERVER_NW_DESCR
data.value: Select the network the print server is connected to.

data.name: PRINTER_PRINT_SERVER_PORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the TCP port for the print server. The default is for an HP printer. If port restrictions are enabled, must be within the restricted port range.

data.name: PROTOCOL_PARAMS_AUTODSC_DESCR
data.value: Allow the Enhanced Diagnostic Monitor to automatically detect this controller on the network when it's connected via configured port

data.name: PROTOCOL_PARAMS_MGMNTPORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the UDP port used for the Enhanced Diagnostic Monitor connection to communication status information. Cannot be the same as the TSAA or TriStation port numbers.

data.name: PROTOCOL_PARAMS_MULT_IP_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address for TSAA multicast messaging. Bin and/or SOE data available messages will be sent to this address. The default 0.0.0.0 address specifies that multicasting is disabled.

data.name: PROTOCOL_PARAMS_MULT_UPDATERATE_DESCR
data.value: Enter the update rate, in milliseconds, for TSAA IP multicasting. Must be in the range 250 - 2000. Multicast messages are sent at the specified rate.

data.name: PROTOCOL_PARAMS_PORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the UDP port used for TriStation connections. Cannot be the same as the TSAA or Management port numbers.

data.name: PROTOCOL_PARAMS_TSAAVER_DESCR
data.value: Select the TSAA protocol version used for multicasting. The selected version must be supported by ALL TSAA clients in the multicast group.

data.name: PROTOCOL_PARAMS_TSAA_PORT_DESCR
data.value: Enter the UDP port used for TSAA connections. Cannot be the same as the TriStation or Management port numbers. Enter 0 to disable TSAA communication on this port.

data.name: ROUTING_GATEWAY_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address of the gateway the controller is connected to. Must be on the NET 1 or NET 2 network.

data.name: ROUTING_IP_ADDRESS_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address used if the controller is not on the same subnet as other devices.

data.name: ROUTING_SUBNET_MASK_DESCR
data.value: Enter the subnet mask address. Must be the same as the subnet mask defined for NET 1 or NET 2 in the Network properties (above).

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_BAUDRATE_DESCR
data.value: Select the data transmission speed for this port.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_CLIENT_PORT_DESCR
data.value: The logical port number used by Modbus client functions to access this port. Must be unique for each TCM in a system. Available only when Modbus Client is selected.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_DATABITS_DESCR
data.value: Select how many bits are in the data format. Available only when Modbus Server ASCII is selected.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_FP_ORDER_DESCR
data.value: Select which section of a 32-bit floating point number is read first. High = first 16 bits. Low = last 16 bits.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_HANDSHAKE_DESCR
data.value: Select if hardware handshaking should be used to establish valid connections between devices. Required when the Wire Type is 2-Wire, or the Transceiver Mode is RS-485.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_MB_MAX_DESCR
data.value: The maximium REAL value that can be communicated over Modbus. Can be no more than 32767.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_MB_MIN_DESCR
data.value: The minimum REAL value that can be communicated over Modbus. Can be no less than -32768.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_MB_SRVR_ADDRESS_DESCR
data.value: Enter the Modbus Server device number (0 - 255). Available only when Modbus Server RTU or Modbus Server ASCII is selected.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_PARITY_DESCR
data.value: Select the type of parity checking to use for detection of data communication errors.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_PROTOCOL_DESCR
data.value: Select the communication protocol for this port.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_STOPBITS_DESCR
data.value: Select how many bits to transmit after each character to indicate that transmission of a byte of data is complete.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_TERMINAL_TYPE_DESCR
data.value: Select the type of termination used with Modbus cable connections. Available only if the Transceiver Mode is RS-485.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_TX_MODE_DESCR
data.value: Select the physical connection mode. Use RS-232 for point-to-point communication up to 50 ft/15.24 m. Use RS-485 for multi-point communication up to 4,000 ft/1219.2 m.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_WIRE_TYPE_DESCR
data.value: Select the type of wire used for serial communication. 2-Wire: A single pair used for Modbus reads and writes. 4-Wire: One pair used for Modbus reads, and a second pair for Modbus writes.

data.name: SP_PARAM_NAME_WRITE_ENABLED_DESCR
data.value: Allow Modbus writes to this port. Available only when Modbus Server RTU or Modbus Server ASCII is selected.

data.name: SYSTEM_CONFIG_DESCRIPTION
data.value: System Configuration parameters affect the overall operation of the Tricon CX system. You need to define how TriStation 1131 connects to the controller and which features are enabled on the controller. You can also view information about how controller memory is allocated for application data, and input, output, and memory tagnames.

data.name: SYSTEM_CONFIG_INVALID_PASTE_PERMISSIONS
data.value: Unable to paste system configuration properties because you do not have the appropriate permissions. Contact your administrator to request permission to modify these properties.

data.name: SYSTEM_CONFIG_TITLE
data.comment: Tricon CX <version> - <MP model number> Main Processor

data.name: TCM_ACCESS_CONTROL_NODE_DESCR
data.value: > COM1 L: {0} COM1 R: {1} COM2 L: {2} COM2 R: {3}

data.name: TCM_CONFIG_PANE_DESCR
data.value: Tricon Communication Module (TCM) settings define how the Tricon CX system communicates with external devices. You need to configure network and serial connections, define the protocols used for communication, configure time synchronization with other systems, set up a printer connection, and specify which clients can access TCM resources. When you make changes to these settings, you must download the updated configuration to the controller.

data.name: TCM_INVALID_PASTE
data.value: Unable to paste communication module properties because one or more column headings are missing or have been modified. Verify the copied data includes these headings: ID, Group, Subgroup, Property, COM1: Left, COM1: Right, COM2: Left, COM2: Right.

data.name: TCM_INVALID_PASTE_PERMISSIONS
data.value: Unable to paste module configuration properties because you do not have the appropriate permissions. Contact your administrator to request permission to modify these properties.

data.name: TCM_PEER_TO_PEER_NODE_DESCR_SPLIT
data.value: > COM1 L: {0} COM1 R: {1} COM2 L: {2} COM2 R: {3}

data.name: TIMESYNC_NETWORK_DESCR
data.value: Select the network the SNTP server is connected to.

data.name: TIMESYNC_PARAMS_PROTOCOL_DESCR
data.value: Select the protocol to use for time synchronization. Select Peer-to-Peer if this controller is the primary node that other Triconex controllers will synchronize their time with.

data.name: TIMESYNC_PARAMS_SNTP_IP_DESCR
data.value: Enter the IP address of the SNTP server to synchronize time with.

data.name: TIMESYNC_PARAMS_USE_DESCR
data.value: Synchronize time to an SNTP server or with other Triconex systems on the Peer-to-Peer network.

data.name: TRISTATION_ALLOW_POINTS_SAFETY_MESSAGE
data.value:
NOTICE
POTENTIAL UNINTENDED OPERATION
You must perform a Download All after changing the {0} property setting. Before making a change to this property, analyze the impact of the controller being halted during the Download All process.
Failure to follow these instructions can result in an unplanned safety system shutdown.
Click OK for more information.

data.name: TRISTATION_REBUILD_ALL_REQUIRED
data.value:
You must perform a Download All after changing the {0} property setting. Are you sure you want to make this change?
Click Yes to change this property and set the project state to Download All (if it is not already). Click No to leave this property unchanged.
